item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 12

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour, sifted
  • 1 Â½ cups granulated sugar
  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened (I use Kerrygold)
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • 3 Â½ teaspoons baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Food coloring (various colors for decoration)
  • Fondant for shaping and detailing
  • Buttercream frosting (homemade or store-bought)

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour your cake pans. I use 9-inch round pans for a classic look.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. This should take about 5 minutes. Trust me, it makes a difference!
  3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Then stir in the vanilla extract.
  4. In another bowl, combine the flour and baking powder. Gradually add this dry mixture to the wet ingredients, alternating with the milk. Mix until just combined.
  5. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans and smooth the tops. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
  6. Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely. This step is crucial for a good texture!

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 20 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 Â¾ cups all-purpose flour, sifted
  • 1 Â½ cups granulated sugar
  • Â¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder (I use Ghirardelli)
  • 1 Â½ teaspoons baking powder
  • 1 Â½ teaspoons baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • Â½ cup vegetable oil
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 cup boiling water
  • 1 cup chocolate frosting (store-bought or homemade)

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. This helps the cakes release easily later.

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
  • 4 medium carrots, sliced

  • 1 large onion, chopped

  • 4 cups beef broth
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste

  • 1 teaspoon rosemary

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef cubes and brown them on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.

  4. Pour in the beef broth and add the tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
  5. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the beef is tender.
  6. Remove the bay leaf before serving. Enjoy your hearty stew!
